thread.title: See Prague’s Street Style Stars Killing It in Distressed Denim
thread.title_full: See Prague’s Street Style Stars Killing It in Distressed Denim

author: Kam Dhillon
title: See Prague’s Street Style Stars Killing It in Distressed Denim
text:
Visit the original post to see all 20 images from this gallery. 
Street Style is an ongoing series shot by Highsnobiety. This week, Copenhagen-based photographer Adam Katz Sinding (the sole force behind Le 21ème) heads to Merecedes-Benz Prague Fashion Week to capture the city’s style set as they take in the Fall/Winter 2017 shows.
Location: Prague, Czech Republic
Season: Fall/Winter 2017
Key Looks: Double trouble Ozweego Bunny by Raf Simons for adidas (slide #7), a sartorial slice of social justice activism (slide #5), and some winning, twinning pin-stripe steez (slide #20)
Editor’s Notes: It seems the Czechs are no strangers to the art of peacocking at fashion week, and as you can see above, they served a smorgasbord of trend-led inspo. As expected, there was plenty of retro sportswear, motocross gear, deconstructed tailoring, and vintage band tees.
The main trend take away? Distress to impress. Given that Prague is a highly underrated treasure trove for vintage threads, it makes sense that the city’s style set offered a solid lesson in wearing vintage denim. From wide leg cut short and worn with ankle boots and buzzy sneakers, to acid-wash slouchy boyfriend fits to fine flares and sublime raw edges, Prague knows how to do denim.
For more street style festivities, take a look at Moscow’s fashionistas wore to fashion week .
